intro: Pterophylla magnifica, commonly known as the grand magnolia, is a striking plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are usually a deep green. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Pterophylla magnifica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
